Reviews.Title: “This is what I'm talking about!”
Reviews.Author: ElectricalTraveller
Reviews.Content: After several less-than-satisfactory hotel stays in the last while, it was such a breath of fresh air to stay here. Where to begin? The staff is fantastic... every single member is friendly, accommodating and helpful; be it the valet, the check-in, the food counter, etc. Kudos to them. The hotel itself is clean, pleasant-looking and functional. The internet was very good throughout the property (note, I paid extra for better internet service). The food counter was very handy for a coffee, or a pizza at night, and the small marketplace (shelves of water, chocolate, chips, etc.) is also great for a quick snack. My king room was clean and, again, functional. Everything that is needed was there. The thermostat was easy to operate. And here's something I absolutely love: More often than not, after spending time removing all the pillows and bedding I don't want, housekeepers usually put everything back on to make everything "pretty", which annoys me, because every night I have to go through the same workout removing everything all over again. Not here! Housekeeping blessedly left aside everything I had removed from the bed, so when I was ready to go to bed, I could GO TO BED. Thanks so much for this small, yet very significant practice. And while the hike to the convention center can be a little onerous from this location, it is possible to do it entirely indoors. A few suggestions for improvement: One reviewer is correct in suggesting better shampoo bottles. Also, my king mattress has started sloping to one side, so I couldn't sleep in the middle of the bed. Another reviewer points out the pool is quite small. I did not use it, but could easily see that it is rather tiny. Might be best to replace it with one large hot tub. That would be great! I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: WDW621
Reviews.Content: My husband and I did a weekend getaway in Indianapolis to see the Cirque du Soleil show and I found this hotel to be conveniently located downtown and decently priced compared to some other hotels in the area. It offers an indoor pool which we didn't utilize but there were always people down there--it's a bit small though. I loved that it was right across the street from several museums and you didn't have to worry about driving and parking there because you could just walk. The staff is very friendly and did everything they could to make sure our stay was pleasant. There's a skywalk that leads to the JW Marriott as well as the convention center. We had a nice king bed room with a view of the baseball diamond and state park. The bed was comfortable and the room was spacious enough for the both of us. All in all we will definitely stay at this hotel again on our next trip to Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: casmkt
Reviews.Content: Stayed during a long weekend business function and couldn't be nicer. Attached to JW Marriott & convention center plus we received an 'event rate' that was awesome! Never had to go outside; Starbucks on the property; yummie restaurants as well. Quiet and within walking distance of downtown only 6 blocks away

Reviews.Title: “Your Average Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: 3chorses
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during Super Bowl week. I found the mattress and pillows to be somewhat uncomfortable as opposed to some of the Hampton Inns I've stayed in. The hotel appears to be relatively new and the service was good. The small shampoos stocked in the room are a pain to open, they need to find an alternative. The parking was inconvenient and the attendants were okay, retrieving my car in a reasonable time period.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel had bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: hippocollector
Reviews.Content: I booked a room because I had to go to IU Medical Hopsital. The room was beautiful!!! We were in room 419. Very clean, and the ambiance was nice. Unfortunately, during my stay, I was bitten by bed bugs all over my body. I caught one crawling across the top comforter and put it in a paper cup and put it in a paper cup and took it down the the front counter. The gal I talked to was very nice, but was very disappointed that I heard nothing from manager, no concern at all. Very upset because the hotel is beautiful, the room was beautiful but had bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice clean and new.”
Reviews.Author: tercel12001
Reviews.Content: Checkin was a breeze. The rooms were awesome and since you are near downtown everything is in walking distance. The only negative is you have to pay 20 a day for parking

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: Mingo05
Reviews.Content: I booked a last minute stay for a sporting event at Lucas Oil Stadium. The hotel was full, but it didn't affect the excellent service we received. Check-in was efficient, staff was friendly and helpful the entire stay. Our room was clean and very quiet-this in spite of the fact that our room was near the elevator and a college marching band was staying on our floor. I enjoy having the Courtyard Bistro in the lobby. They brew Starbucks coffee and you can grab a yogurt parfait & muffin to go, or order hot food to eat in. They serve complimentary cookies in the afternoon. This location is perfect for downtown activities. You can walk to numerous restaurants, the convention center and sporting events. The convention center is accessible via skywalks. Clean, quiet, great location and a top-notch staff! I'll stay here again the next time I'm in Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Another Lovely Stay!”
Reviews.Author: RiverWilson
Reviews.Content: I love Courtyard Indianapolis Downtown. We enjoyed yet another lovely stay in June, spending a weekend in Indy enjoying the many museums, gardens, and restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. (I discovered yet another perk of this conveniently-located hotel. We were able to walk just a few blocks to the canal where we enjoyed a leisurely kayaking trip!) Our room was beautifully clean and the bed was amazingly comfortable. The staff was knowledgeable and friendly and allowed us to enjoy free parking for the entire day after we checked out, so we were able to enjoy the amazing orchid show at the White River Gardens before we got back on the road again. I love this hotel. I will never stay anywhere else while in Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: loimln
Reviews.Content: This is a very convenient complex that includes 4 Marriott hotels -- JW, Courtyard, Fairfield and SpringHIll Suites--all of them connected by an indoor walkway. There are several restaurants on-site including a TGI Fridays and a Starbucks. There is also a small bistro right inside the Courtyard that serves sandwiches, salads, drinks, etc. Front desk and bistro staff were very helpful and courteous. Rooms are clean and well-furnished. I especially liked the security feature where you are required to use a room key to take the elevator to the upper floors. Parking garage was a bit confusing but was OK once you figured out which entrance you needed. Hotel is very close and within waking distance to most Indy attractions and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Karl416
Reviews.Content: This hotel really exceeded my expectations. The room was clean and updated (standard Courtyard decor). The parking garage took a little figuring out at first, but after that it was a snap, and the price seemed reasonable for downtown. The service was great, especially the front desk staff and Bistro staff. Speaking of which, the food quality was good, and they have great hours. There's also a Friday's next door which was also very good. Location was excellent, very close to the Canal Walk, which was great for running. All in all a great experience, and I will be back if/when I'm in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest,and most helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: cancanthebaby
Reviews.Content: Stayed labor day weekend with some friends, had a great time. The staff were helpful in every aspect from giving us directions to broad ripple, honest restaurant reviews, and helping us get a free night during our stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Guest1957
Reviews.Content: Wow!!! great location, service and CLEAN!!!!! Walking distance to ALL Downtown attraction. Valet parking $27 but weell worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! The best service from the staff!”
Reviews.Author: WSG34
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a quick business trip and can't say enough good things about this hotel. All of the staff was amazing and very helpful. Great rooms and layout. If you like to run, you can walk right across the street to the canal area. Nice 1-1/2 mile route each way. TGI Friday's is next to the hotel as well. This hotel is part of the large complex that includes a Fairfield Inn as well as the brand new, JW Marriott. Be aware that overnight Valet parking is $27 (Self parking is $23).

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: letsgoskating
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at this hotel while in Indy due to my regular hotel being full and I wasn't disappointed. I was on the 12th floor and had a beautiful view of the city. My room was larger than expected and the beds were just the right comfort level. The bathrooms were also larger than I'm used to in a hotel. The check-in process also went smoothly. I really have nothing negative to say about this hotel. It was a pleasurable experience staying here.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: JustaDad99
Reviews.Content: My room overlooked that baseball stadium, which for me is perfect even if the season had not started yet. The service in the Bistro was excellent all the time. I was at a conference in the adjoining centre...quite a walk but at least it was inside. Overall a great hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room - Very irritating elevator!”
Reviews.Author: themomky
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 2pm by car - the dropoff area is very small, maybe 6-7cars can fit in circle, but we were lucky - only 2 other cars. Valet helped us right away, though we opted to self park(parking is $23, Valet was only $4 more, but I needed to access car a lot.) Parking garage is for all of the Marriott Hotels and is color coded. I found the garage a little confusing (one of the little things). You enter to an elevator which brings you to a hall between Springhill Suites and the Courtyard. The hall is not very welcoming. I can't put my finger on why exactly, but that is the feeling I got. You aren't sure where one hotel begins and one ends. There is a shared pool and exercise room. Another small irritating thing- not only is the pool tiny (very tiny for a shared pool), but there isn't any pool area to sit. My kids and I chose not to swim because of this. I would avoid this hotel if a pool area is important to you. Fitness room again is tiny for 2 hotels and was full every time we passed. The location is great - easy access to the convention center through the beautiful JW Marriott hotel. Right next to the stadium and across the street from White River Park (caution - there was a concert going on that night and we could hear it in our rooms - mainly the "boom" - kinda like a loud car stereo, only louder. The park provided a great view from our room. The strangest thing was the elevator. For security, you have to put your room key into the elevator INSIDE to stop on your particular floor. This was a bad experience for us. We were on the second floor. EVerytime we rode with other people, we never got our card in before the 2nd floor was passed. Again, an irritant...Not sure how secure this is, because we could have exited the elevator with any of those other people at the floors above ours, which we got to see quite frequently on our up and down rides. The rooms were great. We had plenty of room and 2 queen beds. There was even a small refrigerator in our room. This is a relatively new hotel and it showed. The bathrooms were a great size and were clean. One thing on checkin - the clerk advised us that breakfast was available in the lobby - she probably should add "for purchase"- the way it was presented was that it was complementary and my kids and I completely misunderstood. The clerk was excellent checking us in.

Reviews.Title: “Just About Perfect”
Reviews.Author: michtraveler1969
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard is a new build and is quite stylish and very nice. Checking is the desk attendant was very friendly and gladly changed my room type to a King instead of two doubles. The elevators were always fast and did require a room key for an added layer of safety. The hallways were bright and attractive. The room continued this trend. It was large, clean and modern complete with well designed furniture, a flat screen tv with real HD programming, clean carpeting and a super comfortable bed. There were plenty of spare outlets for Ipods, laptops and cell phone charging. The bathroom was also quite nice with a marble vanity and a walk in shower that had a great shower head and water pressure. The location was very safe and all of the downtown features and attractions were easily walkable. Parking in the garage was a bit of a challenge as it is slightly undersized considering it has to house parking for three different hotels. Finding a spot was next to impossible on a Tuesday morning. Overnight parking was a somewhat reasonable $23. Overall you can't go wrong with this Courtyard. Staff members were efficient and friendly and the hotel itself is new and well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, new hotel”
Reviews.Author: miwohl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for two nights while in town for business. My meetings were at the JW Marriott, which is connected so I didn't even have to venture outside. The hotel feels brand new and the rooms and lobby are spotless and fresh. The bathroom is large, with a nice big counter to spread out your stuff. I stayed on the 15th floor and had a nice view of the museum across the street. Great hotel - - no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL room, EXCELLENT food, AMAZING service!!!”
Reviews.Author: RiverWilson
Reviews.Content: Hands down, the best hotel I've ever stayed in. The staff was amazing. And the location is ideal for people who want to see Indy on foot. The day after our wedding, my husband and I took a little overnight trip to Indianapolis on a whim. Upon arriving, parking was easy to find and the elevator in the parking garage took us directly to the front desk. While we were checking in, I mentioned to the woman at the front desk that we had just been married. She warmly congratulated us, and noticed that we had booked the zoo package. She informed us that we would find our zoo tickets under our door shortly. Our room was beautiful. It was decorated in a modern Asian style with tasteful wallpaper, pretty framed prints, and a plush, downy king-sized bed. The sheets were so cool and soft, we fell asleep as soon as we laid down, even though it was only about four in the afternoon! Sometime during our nap, the zoo tickets appeared under our door as promised. An envelope marked "Mr. and Mrs. Wilson" was also slipped under our door. Inside was a sweet note from the lady at the front desk, congratulating us on our marriage and inviting us to enjoy free breakfast at the bistro in the morning. This was such a pleasant surprise! The front desk also recommended we dine at Weber Grill for dinner, and we were delighted to find that the restaurant was within walking distance. It was a great recommendation and we agreed it was the best meal we had ever eaten. We slept like rocks that night. The room was so quiet and the bed was incredibly comfortable. The next morning, we both showered and the bathroom was amazing. There was beautiful grasscloth wallpaper on the walls, a huge vanity, and a brand new shower. The shower was immaculate (bright white, NO mildew) and the whole place smelled spring-clean! The shower head was top notch and allowed several flow options. And the complimentary toiletries were some kind of botanical brand that smelled heavenly. Breakfast was amazing, and to my amazement, everything was free. Even my Starbucks iced mocha! When we went to check out, the man at the front desk informed us that we were welcome to keep our car parked in the Marriott garage, as the zoo was just across the bridge from the hotel. This saved us having to pay for parking at the zoo, and the walk was beautiful! The staff at this hotel was so courteous and knowledgeable- they made our trip amazing. Some highlights: -Beautiful new flat screen TV in the room with great channel selection. -The bistro across from the front desk serves AMAZING food AND Starbucks coffee. - They keep a beverage dispenser in the lobby filled with orange-infused ice water. It is SUCH a courtesy for guests that are walking to and from the many nearby museums, gardens, and the zoo! It was so appreciated. -TONS of clean towels in the bathrooms. We showered 3 times during our stay and used a clean fresh towel, washcloth, and floor mat each time, and there was still a stack of clean towels left when we checked out. -The hotel had only been open about a year when we stayed there, so everything was really new and clean and modern. -Nice indoor pool and hot tub. -Great security, really friendly, and we had to use the key card to use the elevator, so there isn't a lot of traffic on each floor. The parking garage is also really well-lit. We felt very safe during our stay. -Amazing staff. They went above and beyond to ensure that we had an amazing stay. The Courtyard Downtown is the only hotel we will ever book in Indianapolis- I was actually sad to leave, and I cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff but something was missing”
Reviews.Author: chamomilegardens
Reviews.Content: The staff were absolutely lovely but it was the little things that were missing from the trip. In all fairness, I had obtained the reservation for two nights from an online discount site. While the price paid was more than fair, staying at this hotel took a little work. I was greeted by a very competent front desk clerk who allowed me to choose the type of room I preferred (two queens versus a king). Unfortunately, the first room I was assigned had mildew stains on the sheets and a stain on the arm of the couch. I was promptly assigned me a new room, which was quiet, roomy and well-appointed enough to forgive the view of the construction site below. The hotel overall was very clean and well kept. However, it was the tiny things that made my stay a little more stressful than needed: - First of all, parts of the garage were blocked off and finding my way out with the poorly marked exit signs was a challenge. -When I desired the coffee advertised in the room booklet as free in the lobby, it wasn't there one evening during the designated time. The cheerful front desk staff gave me a cup but wasn't aware it was printed in the booklet. -After purchasing the hummus, pita chips and celery from the small cafe late one night, I had to make an extra trip from down from my sixth floor room after opening the box and realizing the order wasn't correct. I had been simply given hummus and tortilla chips, which was disappointing. The very nice young lady at the counter did apologize and fixed the order promptly. -At check out, another young lady didn't seem able to maneuver the computer very easily and couldn't provide a receipt promptly. (She realized they had forgotten to include the parking charges and she was attempting to add them. However, my own honesty at clarifying my stay was for two nights, rather than one also added yet another $20 to my bill.) After watching the young lady struggle with the computer, I indicated I had a meeting and another woman at the counter said they would email the receipt to me. -Seven hours later after not receiving the emailed receipt, I had to call and request one. It was promptly emailed. All these little corrections made the hotel stay more work than it needed to be. Would I pay full price or recommend someone stay here. I am not sure. However, it was the kindness one morning of a front desk clerk that was greatly appreciated. I had burned my neck accidentally on the hairdryer the first morning and came down looking for burn cream. Although they didn't have any, she also noticed I was looking for coffee in the lobby and insisted on giving me a cup. This simple act and her cheerful attitude in engaging me in conversation later in the day was the Marriott service I'd expected. As a side note regarding wireless, I'd recommend using the provided ethernet line, rather than the wireless. The wireless seemed to be slower and sometimes unreliable. However, the ethernet worked as expected and was quick.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for 3 nights”
Reviews.Author: Bowden68
Reviews.Content: Excellent new Courtyard. This is the "new version" of Courtyard with a very modern feel to it. Very cool lobby. Rooms are good size, and very comfortable with a huge desk, so if you are a business person you will appreciate that fact. Large workout center, a pool and cool restuarant and bar area. I got this hotel for $50 a night on priceline, 3 star. Only downer was parking which was $20 a day. But that is the going rate downtown. Also, there is a Fridays attached to the hotels. Cool place to stay

Reviews.Title: “The kindness of this place brings tears to a Grammy's eyes”
Reviews.Author: LindaAnnDavidRoy
Reviews.Content: My grandson had eye surgery at Riley Hospital for Children. He was too sick to travel 3 hours home, so we booked 2 rooms here. Upon entering the lobby, Evan vomited. The staff saw it coming and grabbed a wastebasket for him. That would have been kind enough BUT they next hurried up and got rooms ready for us, my son's family in one room and me in an adjoining room. (The rooms were great, BTW) Evan was crying blood tears (from his surgery) as he was leaving the lobby. He was still very sick but did fall asleep for a couple hours. In the mean time the staff had put together a 'care' package for him. They sent to our rooms a bag full of goodies for him. I can't tell you how much that meant to our family. Evan's father even sent the company a thank you. We will ALWAYS stay here when we are in Indy!!!

Reviews.Title: “VERY COOL VIEW!”
Reviews.Author: cartender
Reviews.Content: We spent a nice night on the town and the retired @ THE NEW MARRIOTT COURTYARD. The young lady @ check in was VERY PROFESSIONAL. The hotel faced Lucas Oil Stadium & Victory Field. +++THE VIEW WITH THE LIGHTS WAS VERY COOL! +++ VERY SWANKY ACCOMMODATIONS! ALL NEW! I had a couple of very small complaints . The toilet in our room RAN ALL NIGHT. Any playing with the handle would not stop it. Another thing I did not like was I felt paying $25 for over night parking was like paying a hidden fee. However, I WILL DEFINITELY BE BACK AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: kteacher87
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay in downtown Indy. We stayed here 2 nights for the state final basketball tournament. We got an excellent price using priceline.com Only problem was that the glass shower door did not close properly and water leaked onto the floor. I love that is is brand new and the entire hotel is smoke free!! Parking was expensive at $20 per night.

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard Indianapolis Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 601 West Washington Street, Indianapolis, IN 46204
